abstract: A Quaker, a close friend to Lincoln and the only sitting senator to be killed in combat.
snippet: A Quaker, a close friend to Lincoln and the only sitting senator to be killed in combat.
lead_paragraph: Edward Dickinson Baker, a close friend and sometimes political rival of Lincoln's, had no fear of war. In 1832, he left his fledgling law practice in Illinois to participate in the Black Hawk War, and, in 1846, he resigned his Illinois Congressional seat to serve as a colonel of the Fourth Illinois Infantry in the Mexican War.
